metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6381 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In ZZIPlib 0.13.67, 0.13.66, 0.13.65, 0.13.64, 0.13.63, 0.13.62, 0.13.61, 0.13.60, 0.13.59, 0.13.58, 0.13.57 and 0.13.56 there is a segmentation fault caused by invalid memory access in the zzip_disk_fread function (zzip/mmapped.c) because the size variable is not validated against the amount of file->stored data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6381` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzzip-0-13 - 0.13.62-3.1ubuntu0.18.04.1
zziplib-bin - 0.13.62-3.1ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zziplib package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.13.62-3.1ubuntu0.18.04.1').
